channel.title: I am a horrible client sided coder
channel.description: I can't even add models. When i add them to the "Models" folder, and to "Class8.java" I compile and get on errors. Then moving on to server sided, after adding them to item.cfg, i compile no errors. I load up the client, type in my username and password. Log in, spawn the items, and guess what, It's either some disfigured sword looking item, or a willow tree. My coding skills are absolutely abysmal, if i can't even figure this out. Anyways, any help would be appreciated, I'm using a cleaned Delta Iskape Base.

item.title: I am a horrible client sided coder
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

if(i == 6969) // change this if you need to "item number" { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Smell";//New option class8.anInt174 = 16708; // This is what the Model id is! class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.anInt181 = 1300; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 470; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 129; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -1; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Hash Herb";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "This item makes you think you can do the impossible!".getBytes(); }

This is a delta custom item code, just change the 16708 to your model id for the new one and it should work.And change the item number to the rite item number!

Read full topic
